title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Broadcasting Act 2009 (Section 21)
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Broadcasting Act 2009 (Section 21) 

Levy Order 2023. 

(2) This Order comes into operation on the 1 January 2024. 

(3) The Broadcasting Act 2009 (Section 33) Levy Order 2010 (S.I. No. 7 of 
2010) and the Broadcasting Act 2009 (Section 33) Levy Order 2020 (S.I. No. 
521 of 2020) are revoked as and from 31 December 2023.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 2. (1) In this Order, including the schedules unless it is otherwise
text_raw:
2. (1) In this Order, including the schedules unless it is otherwise 

indicated- 

“Act of 2009” means the Broadcasting and Other Media Regulation Acts 2009 
and 2022; 

“date of default” means the date on which a provider fails to pay to the 
Commission a sum which is payable to it under this Order; 

“levy” means a levy imposed by this Order; 

“levy period” means a year in which the Commission operates or, where the 
Commission operates for part only of a year, the part of such year during which 
the Commission operates; 

“overdue sum” means a sum payable to the Commission under this Order 
which a provider has not paid and which remains outstanding; 

“qualified person” means a person who is qualified for appointment as auditor 
of a company under section 468(6) of the Companies Act 2014 as amended; 

“qualifying income” means income so described in Schedule 7 and Schedule 8; 

“provider” means a provider, falling within one or more of the categories of 
providers set out in Schedule 1, who must pay a levy by virtue of a decision 
made by the Commission pursuant to section 21(6) of the Act of 2009; 

“three-month Euribor” means the Euro Interbank Offered Rate with a maturity 
date of three months as advertised by the Euribor EBF Secretariat; 

“VAT” means the tax provided for in the Value-Added Tax Act 1972 (as 
amended). 

(2) In this Order including the schedules unless it is otherwise indicated— 

(a) 

a word or expression defined in the Act of 2009 shall have the 
same meaning when used in this Order; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 22nd December, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [657] 3 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

a reference to legislation is a reference to that legislation as 
amended from time to time; 

a reference to an article or schedule is to an article of or 
schedule to this Order; 

a reference to a sub-article is to the sub-article of the provision 
in which the reference occurs unless it is indicated that a 
reference to another provision is intended; and 

a reference in a schedule to a paragraph is to a paragraph in the 
schedule in which the reference appears unless it is indicated 
that a reference to another provision is intended.

heading: 5. (1) A levy is hereby imposed on providers in respect of the levy period
text_raw:
5. (1) A levy is hereby imposed on providers in respect of the levy period 

in which the providers are in operation as such. 

(2) For the removal of doubt, a levy is hereby imposed on a provider in 
respect of a levy period in which it is in operation as such, notwithstanding that 
it has not been in operation as such for all of such levy period.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 6. The Commission shall seek to ensure that the amount of any levy
text_raw:
6. The Commission shall seek to ensure that the amount of any levy 
imposed on providers in respect of a levy period shall be sufficient to meet the 
Commission’s expenses properly incurred and its working capital requirements 
in that levy period, in so far as those expenses and requirements are not met in 
any other way.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 8. Having determined that a provider must pay a levy in respect of a levy
text_raw:
8. Having determined that a provider must pay a levy in respect of a levy 

period the Commission shall determine— 

(1) the amount of such levy in accordance with the methodologies for the 
relevant providers set out in Schedule 2, Schedule 3, Schedule 4, Schedule 5 
and Schedule 6 as applicable; and 

(2) either that such levy is to be paid in one sum on or before a specified 

date, or that it is to be paid by way of instalments.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 12. A provider which is obliged to make a payment of a levy to the
text_raw:
12. A provider which is obliged to make a payment of a levy to the 
Commission shall make such payment by electronic funds transfer to the bank 
account which the Commission has by way of notice in writing to the provider 
specified for such purpose. Where a provider has initiated an electronic funds 
transfer, it shall promptly notify the Commission of the date on which such 
transfer was initiated, the amount which is to be transferred and the name of 
the bank which is to effect the transfer.

text_raw:

require that a provider provide to the Commission on or before a date specified 
in such notice and in such manner as may be prescribed by the Commission — 

(1) accounts for any financial period as specified by the Commission; 

(2) a statement showing its qualifying income within any such financial 

period; and/or 

(3) a statement showing the average monthly users within any such 

financial period.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 17. (1) Where a provider is obliged, under article 16, to retain a record
text_raw:
17. (1) Where a provider is obliged, under article 16, to retain a record 
which relates to one financial period only, it shall retain such record for six 
years from the end of such financial period. 

(2) Where a provider is obliged, under article 16, to retain a record which 
relates to more than one financial period, it shall retain such record for six 
years from the end of the latest period to which such record relates.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 27. Any surplus of income, from levies imposed under this Order, in excess
text_raw:
27. Any surplus of income, from levies imposed under this Order, in excess 
of the expenses properly incurred by the Commission and its working capital 
requirements in a levy period shall be deemed to be monies derived through the 
imposition of a levy for a levy period and shall either: 

(1) be retained by the Commission to be offset against levy obligations for 

the subsequent year; or 

(2) be refunded proportionately to the relevant providers on whom the levy 

concerned was imposed.
text_norm: 27 surplus income levy imposed order excess expense properly incurred commission working capital requirement levy period shall deemed monies derived imposition levy levy period shall either (1) retained commission offset levy obligation subsequent year (2) refunded proportionately relevant provider levy concerned imposed

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: CATEGORIES OF PROVIDERS WHO MUST PAY A LEVY
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 1 

CATEGORIES OF PROVIDERS WHO MUST PAY A LEVY 

In accordance with section 21 of the Act of 2009, this Order is applicable to the 
following providers: 

(1) Providers of audiovisual media services; 

(2) Providers of sound broadcasting services; and 

(3) Providers of designated online services.

heading: 7. A television programme service provider whose base year qualifying
text_raw:
7. A television programme service provider whose base year qualifying 
income is more than €500,000 must, in respect of the levy period, pay a levy 
which is computed by reference to its base year qualifying income in 
accordance with the following table— 

Base year qualifying income 

Percentage Levy 

€1 to €1,000,000 

€1,000,001 to €10,000,000 

€10,000,001 to €20,000,000 

€20,000,001 to €45,000,000 

B % 

(B — .25) % 

(B — .50) % 

(B — .75) % 

Over €45,000,000 

(B — 1.75) %

heading: 8. The table in paragraph 7 shall be applied so that, for example,—
text_raw:
8. The table in paragraph 7 shall be applied so that, for example,— 

(a) 

(b) 

a levy payer whose base year qualifying income is not more than 
€1,000,000 must, in the levy period, pay a levy which is equal to 
B % of its base year qualifying income; and 

a levy payer whose base year qualifying income is more than 
€1,000,000 but is not more than €10,000,000 must, in the levy

first €1,000,000 of its base year qualifying income and (B — 
.25) % of its base year qualifying income over €1,000,000.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: In this schedule—
text_raw:
1. 

In this schedule— 

“broadcasting funding scheme” means a scheme administered by the 
Commission by virtue of Part 10 of the Act of 2009, or a scheme under section 
154 of the Act of 2009 

“commercial communication” means a communication so described in 
paragraph 6; 

“Government” means the Government provided for in Bunreacht na hÉireann; 

“interactive income” means income generated by a provider from listener or 
viewer response to a broadcast including, without limitation, telephony income 
and income from online payments which are so generated; 

“non-linear service” means a service provided by a television programme 
service provider whereby a person may view or listen to programmes at the 
moment chosen by the user and at his or her individual request on the basis of a 
catalogue of programmes selected by the television programme service 
provider; 

“public body” means an entity whose decisions are subject to judicial review. 

“provider” means each provider of services set out in this Order whose levy 
shall be determined based on qualifying income.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: In this schedule “commercial communication” means images, with or
text_raw:
6. 

In this schedule “commercial communication” means images, with or 
without sound, and radio announcements which are designed to promote, 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 20 [657] 

directly or indirectly, the products, services or image of a natural or legal entity 
pursuing an economic activity. Such images and radio announcements 
accompany or are included in a programme in return for payment or for similar 
consideration or for self-promotional purposes. Forms of audiovisual 
commercial communication include, inter alia, advertising, sponsorship, 
teleshopping and product placement but do not include public service 
announcements and charity appeals broadcast free of charge.

heading: 4. Money which the Commission pays to a provider under a broadcasting
text_raw:
4. Money which the Commission pays to a provider under a broadcasting 

funding scheme is not qualifying income of that provider.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 5. Subject to paragraph 8, income of a provider from commercial
text_raw:
5. Subject to paragraph 8, income of a provider from commercial 
communications (including late payment surcharges and cancellation penalties) 
net of agent’s commission, computed on a normal accruals basis, is qualifying 
income of that provider.
text_norm: 5 subject paragraph 8 income provider commercial communication (including late payment surcharge cancellation penalties) net agent commission computed normal accrual basis qualifying income provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: In this schedule “commercial communication” means images, with or
text_raw:
6. 

In this schedule “commercial communication” means images, with or 
without sound, and radio announcements which are designed to promote, 
directly or indirectly, the products, services or image of a natural or legal entity 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [657] 23 

pursuing an economic activity. Such images and radio announcements 
accompany or are included in a programme in return for payment or for similar 
consideration or for self-promotional purposes. Forms of audiovisual 
commercial communication include, inter alia, advertising, sponsorship, 
teleshopping and product placement but do not include public service 
announcements and charity appeals broadcast free of charge.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 7. Where a provider gives early payment discounts and/or volume
text_raw:
7. Where a provider gives early payment discounts and/or volume 
discounts in respect of commercial communications such discounts may be 
taken into account in computing the qualifying income of the provider.
text_norm: 7 provider give early payment discount volume discount respect commercial communication discount may taken account computing qualifying income provider

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 8. Where a provider pays commission to an agent in respect of a
text_raw:
8. Where a provider pays commission to an agent in respect of a 
commercial communication and such commission exceeds 15% of the amount 
payable to the provider by the person for whom such communication is 
broadcast, the amount by which such commission exceeds 15% may not be 
deducted in computing such provider’s qualifying income.
text_norm: 8 provider pay commission agent respect commercial communication commission exceeds 15 amount payable provider person communication broadcast amount commission exceeds 15 may deducted computing provider qualifying income

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 9. Subject to paragraph 10, where reasonable provision is made in the
text_raw:
9. Subject to paragraph 10, where reasonable provision is made in the 
audited accounts of a provider for bad debts relating to commercial 
communications, a corresponding deduction may be made in computing such a 
provider’s qualifying income.
text_norm: 9 subject paragraph 10 reasonable provision made audited account provider bad debt relating commercial communication corresponding deduction may made computing provider qualifying income

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 10. No such deduction, as is referred to in paragraph 9, may be made for a
text_raw:
10. No such deduction, as is referred to in paragraph 9, may be made for a 
provision for bad debts to the extent that the income to which such provision 
relates would not be qualifying income.
text_norm: 10 deduction referred paragraph 9 may made provision bad debt extent income provision relates would qualifying income

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 11. Subject to paragraphs 5 and 8, costs incurred by a provider in securing
text_raw:
11. Subject to paragraphs 5 and 8, costs incurred by a provider in securing 
commercial communications may not be deducted in computing such a 
provider’s qualifying income.
text_norm: 11 subject paragraph 5 8 cost incurred provider securing commercial communication may deducted computing provider qualifying income

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 12. Where a provider receives non-cash consideration for a commercial
text_raw:
12. Where a provider receives non-cash consideration for a commercial 
communication, the qualifying income of the provider shall be increased by an 
amount equal to the Commission’s estimate of the value of such non-cash 
consideration.
text_norm: 12 provider receives non-cash consideration commercial communication qualifying income provider shall increased amount equal commission estimate value non-cash consideration

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 13. Subject to paragraph 14, where a provider generates interactive income
text_raw:
13. Subject to paragraph 14, where a provider generates interactive income 

such income is qualifying income of that provider.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 14. Where a provider generates interactive income through broadcasting
text_raw:
14. Where a provider generates interactive income through broadcasting 
programmes featuring competitions, the value of prizes awarded to participants 
may be deducted in computing qualifying income, but no deduction may be 
made for the value of a prize which is provided at the cost of a third party.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 15. Costs incurred by a provider in providing interactive services or
text_raw:
15. Costs incurred by a provider in providing interactive services or 

applications may not be deducted in computing qualifying income.
text_norm: 15 cost incurred provider providing interactive service application may deducted computing qualifying income

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: 16. All qualifying income should be apportioned to the service in which it
text_raw:
16. All qualifying income should be apportioned to the service in which it 
was raised. Where such an apportionment is not possible, qualifying income 
shall be spread across all services provided by the provider based on 
percentage breakdown of apportioned qualifying income of all the services 
provided by the provider.

title: by section 21 of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009) (as substituted by
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order imposes a levy on certain specified classes of providers of 
audiovisual media service providers, providers of sound broadcasting services 
and providers of designated online services, for the purpose of meeting the 
Commission’s expenses properly incurred and its working capital requirements 
in respect of a levy period, in so far as those expenses and requirements are not 
met in any other way.
